result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Plea/sentencing hearing on November 22, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on November 22, 2022 at 11:00 am.

1:44 PM Defendant Autumn Fawn Gernon in court, in custody.  Attorney Leonie Dolch in court for Autumn Fawn Gernon.  Prosecuting attorney Rick C Spoentgen in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Court states cases and appearances.  Court orders the bond not be forfeited in 22CF125.  Atty Dolch will reach out to get a plea/sent date on both matters.  Bonds continued.
Status hearing on September 26, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

1:45 PM Defendant Autumn Fawn Gernon in court, in custody.  Attorney Leonie Dolch in court for Autumn Fawn Gernon.  Prosecuting attorney Emily Eklund in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Court states cases and parties state appearances.  Atty Dolch notes DE is being held in Dodge Co on $10,000 cash bond.  Atty Dolch acknowledges rec. informations in 22CF32 and 22CF125 and waives reading.  Court advises DE of charges/max penalties.  Atty Dolch stands mute.  Court enters NG pleas to all counts.  Matters to be placed on calendar in Br 3.  Court orders warrants be quashed.  Atty Dolch to be in touch w/Br 3 re: scheduling.
Status hearing scheduled for September 19, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
